subject: Custom Runner Delegation

messageBody:
So let's say you have a class that generically handles grabbing
appropriate beans, db connections, what-have-you. Let's say further
that in order for it to do this correctly for your purposes, you've
created a custom runner and annotated your file using the appropriate
@RunWith(MyCustomRunner.class) notation.

Then you subclass that file some moderately large number of times, say
a dozen times at the next level and who-knows-how-many subclass each
of those, where each is doing its own various and sundry tests.

Then let's say you run one of those tests directly.

What runner should it use if none is specified in the subclass? The
default "TestClassRunner" or the parent class's "MyCustomRunner"?

Currently it uses the default runner rather than its parents' custom
one. Would it make sense to have runners be inherited from their parents?
